name: P2Pool on Raspberry Pi
tagline: Low Latency and Low Power Consumption P2Pool
body:
# I'm creating P2Pools that can run on a [Raspberry Pi](http://amzn.to/1peyhoc)!

***

To get started you will need to do a little shopping:

* [Raspberry Pi B+](http://amzn.to/1peyhoc)
* [Raspberry Pi B+ Case](http://amzn.to/1peyKqq) - Others will do, but this is cheap and well made.
* [Power Supply](http://amzn.to/1peyQOT)
* [SDHC Micro SD Card](http://amzn.to/1peyWWC)
* [Ethernet Cable](http://amzn.to/Y0C6YY) - Recommended.
* [WiFi Dongle](http://amzn.to/Y0C9UD) - Not recommended, but if your only choice.

***

Install Raspbian with floating point support from the [Raspberry Pi](http://www.raspberrypi.org/downloads/) website.

You now have everything you need to start making your P2Pool. Check the main [GitHub](https://github.com/P2PoolOnPi) and choose your chosen P2Pool to build.

***

Donations to this project are always welcome. Especially as building new pools costs for equipment and time.

* Donations in Doge: DFsJtx8YCVd8fuWj5GFijYcg3RfvZnDd7v
* Donations in Bitcoin: 1AjBcNSvnZsn3ESAH491hUbBrwM4Jmcuy9
* Donations in Litecoin: LMFYddxyfsPw4oxNGQMwLBUohqj7PmwiXH

***

## FIRE NEWS

I do not hold [Raspberry Pi](http://www.raspberrypi.org/) or [Jenkins](http://jenkins-ci.org/) responsible in any way for the events.

A few days ago I had everything set up running in Jenkins to connect to the Raspberry Pi and attempt to build each of the pools. It would then attempt to mine a share on the P2Pool before resulting in a pass or a failure.

Well it turns out I must have over stressed the Raspberry Pi with all this testing. This led to a small electrical fire in my testing lab. No serious damage was done, apart from a little breadboard and some cabling. However the Raspberry Pi is damaged beyond repair. I have contacted the retailer who has told me that fire is not covered in their replacement guide. I will contact Raspberry Pi directly, however I have little faith in getting this resolved.

This project is on hold until I can get a replacement Raspberry Pi and identify the fault that led to the electrical failure.
